definition: not yet/did not/have not/not/8th earthly branch: 1-3 p.m., 6th solar month (7th July-6th August), year of the Sheep/ancient Chinese compass point: 210°

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble

sentences.english: He was too lazy to exert himself and rusted out long before his time.
sentences.chinese: 他懶得萎靡不振，因此早就未老先衰了。

sentences.english: Uses in the facial color being plain, presenility, the flesh is dry, looks wan.
sentences.chinese: 用於面色無華，未老先衰，肌膚乾燥，形容憔悴。

sentences.english: Money was the tragedy of the family. It made an old woman of me before my time.
sentences.chinese: 錢財對於家庭是個悲劇，使我未老先衰。

sentences.english: He was so lazy that he rusted out when he was still young.
sentences.chinese: 他懶極了，因此未老先衰。

sentences.english: The sun can cause premature ageing.

definition: to age/to deteriorate with age/old and weak
baldness/to lose hair or feathers/to molt/depilation
to be in the prime of life
impotence/also written 陽痿|阳痿[yang2 wei3]
